titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Etienne Dutilh, a French merchant, emigrated to Philadelphia in 1783 and established several commercial firms including E. Dutilh & Company, 1783-1789; Dutilh & Wachsmuth, with John Godfried Wachsmuth, 1790-1797; and Dutilh, Soullier & Company, with John Soullier, 1793-circa 1797. These firms were largely engaged in the West Indies and northern European trade, with sugar, coffee, cocoa, and logwood being the major commodities mentioned. Dutilh died in 1810, Wachsmuth died c. 1826.

scopecontent.p: This collection is split into two subgroups: the business paper of Stephen Dutilh and the business papers of the firm Dutilh & Wachsmuth. The business papers of Stephen Dutilh include: bills and receipts; account statements; the account book of the brig Hetty; an insurance claim by the owners of the brig Betsy, and an index of Dutilh's accounts. This subgroup also includes four bound volumes: Dutilh's address book (written in French and alphabetized by city) entitled "Livre de la Correspondence Generale," and account books for the years 1783-1788 (in French), 1792-1795, and 1795-1809. The papers of Dutilh & Wachsmuth consist of correspondence, bills of lading, invoices, orders, and account statements. This subgroup also includes a blank power-of-attorney, a map [c. 1764] entitled "A New Map or Chart in Mercators Projection of the Western or Atlantic Ocean with part of Europe Africa and America," a promissory note, and a check on the Bank of the United States.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
